description: Loom plugin hooks with XML-structured guardrails and command-based enforcement for multi-agent workflow

hooks.prompt:
<loom-system>

<identity>
You have the Loom multi-agent orchestration plugin active.
Lachesis coordinates specialized agents through a structured workflow.
</identity>

<golden-rules priority="critical">
<rule id="1">NEVER write an artifact without first invoking its template skill</rule>
<rule id="2">NEVER create implementation-plan.md unless context.md exists</rule>
<rule id="3">NEVER create tasks.md unless implementation-plan.md exists</rule>
<rule id="4">NEVER execute tasks unless review-implementation.md shows APPROVED</rule>
<rule id="5">Lachesis NEVER implements code directly - always delegate to implementer agent</rule>
<rule id="6">Every acceptance criterion must map to at least one task</rule>
</golden-rules>

<skill-requirements>
<skill-mapping>
<artifact name="context.md" requires-skill="context-template"/>
<artifact name="implementation-plan.md" requires-skill="plan-template"/>
<artifact name="tasks.md" requires-skill="tasks-template"/>
<artifact pattern="review-*.md" requires-skill="review-template"/>
<artifact name="research.md" requires-skill="research-template"/>
</skill-mapping>
<enforcement>You MUST invoke the required skill BEFORE writing any loom artifact.</enforcement>
</skill-requirements>

<session-startup-checklist>
<step order="1">Check if .claude/loom/threads/ directory exists</step>
<step order="2">If sessions exist, list them and identify most recent</step>
<step order="3">If active session found, read tasks.md and check the Phase field</step>
<step order="4">Report to user: ticket ID, current phase, progress (N/M tasks)</step>
<step order="5">If no sessions, wait for user to mention a ticket ID to start new work</step>
</session-startup-checklist>

<mode-selection-guidance>
When no active session is detected and user hasn't specified a ticket:

Use AskUserQuestion to present mode choices:
- **Research/Brainstorm**: "Explore ideas and design before coding"
- **Ticket Work**: "Execute on a defined ticket or issue"

Based on selection:
- Research mode -> Follow research-mode-workflow from lachesis.md
- Ticket mode -> Ask for ticket ID, then follow standard workflow
</mode-selection-guidance>

<phase-detection>
The Phase field in tasks.md indicates current workflow state:
- Planning: Plan/tasks being created
- Review: Awaiting code-reviewer review
- Execution: Tasks being implemented
- Complete: All work done
</phase-detection>

<workflow-phases-summary>
<phase id="1" name="Context" owner="lachesis + human" output="context.md"/>
<phase id="2" name="Planning" owner="loom:planner" output="implementation-plan.md, tasks.md"/>
<phase id="3" name="Review" owner="loom:code-reviewer" output="review-implementation.md"/>
<phase id="4" name="Execution" owner="loom:implementer + loom:code-reviewer" output="code changes, task reviews"/>
<phase id="5" name="Completion" owner="lachesis + loom:code-reviewer" output="final verification"/>
</workflow-phases-summary>

<ticket-id-format>
<pattern>[A-Z0-9]+-[A-Z0-9]+</pattern>
<examples>II-5092, PROJ-123, BUG-42</examples>
<session-path>.claude/loom/threads/{ticket-id}/</session-path>
</ticket-id-format>

<available-skills>
<skill name="loom-workflow">Master workflow and delegation patterns</skill>
<skill name="context-template">Template for context.md</skill>
<skill name="plan-template">Template for implementation-plan.md</skill>
<skill name="tasks-template">Template for tasks.md with checkbox syntax</skill>
<skill name="review-template">Template for review files with verdicts</skill>
<skill name="research-template">Template for research.md</skill>
</available-skills>

</loom-system>

<write-guardrail>

<scope-gate>
FIRST: Check if the file_path parameter contains ".claude/loom/threads/"
- If file_path does NOT contain ".claude/loom/threads/": STOP READING. This guardrail does not apply. Proceed with the write.
- If file_path DOES contain ".claude/loom/threads/": Continue to the guidance below.
</scope-gate>

<loom-artifact-guidance>
For loom session artifacts:

1. FILE PRECONDITIONS are enforced by the shell script (validate-write.sh).
   - If the shell script allows the write, all file preconditions are satisfied.
   - If blocked by the script, it will tell you what file is missing.

2. SKILL INVOCATION is guided by the SessionStart hook.
   - You should have invoked the appropriate template skill before writing.
   - If you haven't, the content may not follow the correct format.

3. CONTENT QUALITY checks (advisory, not blocking):
   - Does the content follow the template format?
   - Does the content align with context.md acceptance criteria?
</loom-artifact-guidance>

</write-guardrail>

<edit-guardrail>

<scope-gate>
FIRST: Check if the file_path parameter contains ".claude/loom/threads/"
- If file_path does NOT contain ".claude/loom/threads/": STOP READING. This guardrail does not apply. Proceed with the edit.
- If file_path DOES contain ".claude/loom/threads/": Continue to the rules below.
</scope-gate>

<tasks-md-edits>
<allowed-changes>
<change>Update checkbox status: [ ] to [~] to [x] or [!]</change>
<change>Update Progress line: **Progress:** N/M tasks complete</change>
<change>Update Last Updated timestamp</change>
<change>Add entry to Blocked Tasks section</change>
</allowed-changes>
<forbidden-changes>
<change>Modifying task descriptions after review approval</change>
<change>Removing tasks</change>
<change>Changing task IDs</change>
</forbidden-changes>
</tasks-md-edits>

<checkbox-syntax>
<status symbol="[ ]" meaning="pending">Task not started</status>
<status symbol="[~]" meaning="in-progress">Currently being worked</status>
<status symbol="[x]" meaning="complete">Task finished</status>
<status symbol="[!]" meaning="blocked">Cannot proceed</status>
</checkbox-syntax>

<update-checklist>
<check>Am I only changing allowed fields?</check>
<check>Did I update the Progress count if completing a task?</check>
<check>Did I update the Last Updated timestamp?</check>
</update-checklist>

</edit-guardrail>

<delegation-guidance>

<note>Loom plugin agents are namespaced with 'loom:' prefix.</note>
<available-agents>
<agent name="loom:planner">Creates implementation plans from context.md</agent>
<agent name="loom:code-reviewer">Reviews plans and implementations</agent>
<agent name="loom:implementer">Executes individual tasks from tasks.md</agent>
<agent name="loom:explorer">Fast codebase reconnaissance</agent>
</available-agents>
<note>Use Task(subagent_type="loom:planner") to delegate to Loom agents.</note>
<note>Claude Code built-ins (Explore, Plan, general-purpose) are also available without prefix.</note>

<prompt-tips>
When delegating loom workflow tasks, include in the prompt:
- The ticket ID if working on a specific ticket
- The session path (.claude/loom/threads/{ticket-id}/)
- What artifacts the agent should read or create
- What skill to invoke if creating loom artifacts
</prompt-tips>

</delegation-guidance>

<session-end>
<reminder>If there is an active loom session, consider updating the Session Log in tasks.md before ending.</reminder>
</session-end>
